intro: Triumfetta wittei, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its adaptability to harsh environments makes it an important component of local ecosystems.
